definition: to make known to the masses (idiom); to publicize widely/to let the world know

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
surname Yu
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]
in/at/to/from/by/than/out of
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives
many/numerous/crowd/multitude
variant of 眾|众[zhong4]

sentences.english: I thank countries who are making the results of their investigations publicly available.
sentences.chinese: 我衷心感谢将调查结果公之于众的国家。

sentences.english: But rather than keep it in the family, Fukuyama went public.
sentences.chinese: 他没有把这当成家事，而是公之于众。

sentences.english: Two people find Han Zhiming, will reveal to the public the doings of the.
sentences.chinese: 二人找到韩志明，将其的所作所为公之于众。

sentences.english: We are fearless in our efforts to get the unvarnished truth out to the public.
sentences.chinese: 我们勇敢的致力于把原样的真相公之于众。

sentences.english: The announcement would be made public soon.
sentences.chinese: 这一公告将很快公之于众。

sentences.english: The child molester was named and shamed by the police, when they released his name and photos to the public.
sentences.chinese: 虐童者罪行被警方公开，他的名字和照片被公之于众。

sentences.english: The anti-climatic deal of the year is now out.
sentences.chinese: 今年最反气候的一笔交易现在公之于众。

sentences.english: The Morells don't have a name picked out for their son and aren't likely to make it public.
sentences.chinese: 莫儿勒夫妇还未为儿子选好名字，也不想公之于众。

sentences.english: The design hasn't been finalized, but his sketches have been made public.
sentences.chinese: 虽然尚未最终定稿，但设计草图已经被公之于众了。

sentences.english: No picture or film was made public.
sentences.chinese: 没有任何图片或影像公之于众。

sentences.english: And he's continually willing to make that belief a public one.
sentences.chinese: 然后他愿意把它不断地公之于众。

definition: to announce to the world (idiom)/to make public/to let everyone know
to announce to the world (idiom)/to make public/to let everyone know
to expose/to unmask/to ferret out/to disclose/disclosure
public/to publish/to make public
to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
to publicize/openness (of government, PRC equivalent of "glasnost")
secrets/private business/privacy
to conceal/to hide (a taboo subject)/to cover up the truth
scandal
family scandal/skeleton in the closet
to expose/to uncover
to keep sth confidential/to maintain secrecy
to know/to understand
to leak secrets
to expose (photography)/(fig.) to expose (a scandal)/(advertising) exposure/Taiwan pr. [pu4 guang1]
to be thoroughly discredited/to fall into disrepute
